data.text:
Kyle Ryan Wagner, 33, of Sheboygan, went to his LORD Friday morning January 8th, 2021 at his home from a pulmonary edema.

Born November 14th, 1987, in Sheboygan, Kyle was the son of Arthur and Christine (nee Reseburg) Wagner. Kyle Graduated from Pigeon River Elementary School, Urban Middle School, and Sheboygan North High School. While at Sheboygan North High he enjoyed competing in cross country running. Kyle served as a combat medic from 2007 thru 2010 completing one tour in Iraq. He received an honorable discharge from the United States Military. Upon returning from active duty, he attended Lakeshore Technical College and attained an Associate’s Degree in Criminal Justice. His last full-time position was as an officer in the Sheboygan Police Department in 2020.

Kyle enjoyed drumming, reading, the outdoors, hunting, compound bow & firearm target shooting, and riding his motorcycle. He bonded with a beautiful Labralas service dog which he trained himself named Jade. He especially loved and enjoyed spending time with his friends and family. He loved people and was always wanting to give a hand and help anyone who needed support.

He was a member of Bethlehem Lutheran Church located at 1121 Georgia Avenue, Sheboygan, WI 53081. He was baptized on April, 17th 1988 by Pastor Hartman. He was confirmed on May, 19th 2002.

On November, 11th of 2019 he proposed and was engaged to his love, Stevie Mckenna. They were to be married in the summer of 2021. They had a son together named Benjamin Arthur Wagner.

He is survived by his fiancée Stevie Mckenna and her daughter Brook Piehl, whom he loved as his own daughter; newborn son Benjamin Arthur Wagner; parents Arthur and Christine Wagner; and his brother Eric Arthur Wagner. He loved his family dearly.

Cremation was handled by Reinbold-Novak Funeral Home. There will be no visitation at the funeral home. A private memorial service will be held at a later date. The Rev. Patrick Niles, of Bethlehem Lutheran Church, will officiate.

A memorial fund is being set up for his beloved son Benjamin Arthur Wagner in lieu of flowers.

Kyle will be deeply missed by his beloved fiancée, family, and friends as they patiently wait to be reunited in the everlasting life through Christ Jesus which is to come.

O Gracious LORD, absolve, we beseech Thee, the soul of Thy servant, from every bond of sin; that in the glory of the Resurrection, amongst Thy saints and elect, he may rise unto newness of life. This we ask through Christ Jesus, Our LORD. Amen.

Eternal rest grant unto him, O LORD, and let the perpetual light shine upon him. May he rest in peace. Amen.

Guestbook Entries SIGN GUESTBOOK

Tina Grunow Frankovis

Art and Chris I’m so deeply sorry to hear about your son. My thought and prayers are with you and the rest of the family.

Connie Campbell

Art and Chris, you have my deepest sympathies on the loss of your son. It has to hurt so badly to lose your child. My hope is that the memories you have can comfort you, and that God eases the pain .

Judith Mertes

Art and Christine, I am so sorry of the loss of Kyle. Art and I would often talk of our children. You could always see how proud of his boys. May he rest in peace, God be with you.

Edward J Procek

William wiroll

Sorry for your loss 1st sgt Wagner thoughts and prayers to you and your family

Kaye Daane

We are so very sorry to hear of your loss. We so enjoyed when Kyle would come over when Jake was in town and of course we will always remeber those high school "Out of the Blue" band days! We wish your entire family much strength as you grieve and much joy as you watch little Benjamin grow.

Ambrose J Schmitz

Heartfelt sympathy is extended to the family of Kyle Wagner. He is in the good hands of our Lord forever. Sadness is overshadowed by the good life Kyle did have prior to his illness. Blessings to all from TREA Chapter 76 and never forget Kyle! Ambrose Schmitz SMSgt US Air Force Retired

James Schmidt

Please keep friends posted on details for memorial for Kyle's newborn son - that's a great idea. My deepest condolences on your loss. I'm sure he's looking down on everyone.

Kevin Wagner

Our condolences to you on the passing of Kyle. Karen and I have only good memories of him. He was a wonderful young man full of promise. May fond memories of your son bring you confort at this time in your life. Our prayers are with you and your family

Grace Hartman

I am so sorry to read of Kyle’s passing. My thoughts and prayers are with you all .

Kristen Hury

So sorry to hear of the passing of Kyle. May god’s healing presence help you in this time of need. Hugs. Kris

Roger Hendricks

My sincere condolences to the entire family. I am so sorry for your lost.

Sue & Rick Herman

Oh my gosh! I am SO sorry to hear this. I lost my great-nephew Joshua Gordon 38 this week. 2021 is not starting out too good. I cant imagine losing a child so unexpectedly.

Michael Bernhardt

Art and Christine, we are so sorry for your loss. I never met Kyle but Art talked a lot about him at work. I know how much he meant to you. Roxi and I will keep you in our prayers.

Karen Voss

I am heartbroken for your loss! I am so sorry!

Claudette Forss

To the Wagner family and Kyles fiancée I was saddened to hear of Kyles untimely death from his uncle Ken . May the memories you shared of him get you through this time of grief . Sincerely , Claudette Forss

Jordan Cline

Kyle, in the time we have been friends you were more like a brother to me always making jokes and turned the bright light on dull situations. You will be missed dearly. Rest your soul brother see you soon.

David Taft

Kyle, you were an inspiration to me during our time together. You will be missed.

Keeley Reseburg

Kyle, I will keep my memories of you close to my heart always, until we meet again cousin. I love and miss you so.

Jeremiah Pritzl

Kyle, I always enjoyed seeing your smiling face come in to class. You are missed. Until Valhalla!
